>cd poc-workspace

\poc-workspace>mkdir gemini-playground

\poc-workspace>cd gemini-playground

\poc-workspace\gemini-playground>mkdir character-creation-poc

\poc-workspace\gemini-playground>cd character-creation-poc

\poc-workspace\gemini-playground\character-creation-poc>gemini

1. Ask questions, edit files, or run commands.
2. Be specific for the best results.
3. Create GEMINI.md files to customize your interactions with Gemini.
4. /help for more information.


> I would like a Spring application, using maven, that had the endpoints responsible for character creation in
   a MMORPG. You should be able to: create a account, create characters to that account to a maximum of 20
  characters per account, mark a character for deletion (that will be deleted after 30 days of being marked)
  and edit a character details. The only detail that can be edited from the character will be a comment, which
   will be a player input field. Name, level, vocation and class cannot be edited. The db of choice for now
  can be H2. Also generate a README.md at the project root that explains all the endpoints created, what they
  do and how to properly run the application.

✦ Okay, I will create a Spring Boot application with Maven that provides REST endpoints for character creation
   in an MMORPG. The application will use an in-memory H2 database and include a README.md file with
  instructions.


  First, I'll generate the project structure using the Spring Initializr.
 ╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  Shell curl "https://start.spring.io/starter.zip?type=maven-project&language=java&platformVersion=3.3.1&p… │
 │                                                                                                              │
                         │ed: Port number was not a decimal number between 0 and 65535
 │                                                                                                              │
 ╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ The curl command failed. I'll try again to download the zip file from the Spring Initializr.
 ╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  Shell curl -o character-creation.zip "https://start.spring.io/starter.zip?type=maven-project&language=ja… │
 │                                                                                                              │
                         │ed: Port number was not a decimal number between 0 and 65535
 │                                                                                                              │
 ╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ It seems that curl is having issues with the URL. I'll try a different approach by using web_fetch to get
  the zip file.
 ╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ⊶  WebFetch Processing URLs and instructions from prompt: "Download the zip file from https://start.spr… │
 ╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

> I would like a Spring application, using maven, that had the endpoints responsible for character creation in
   a MMORPG. You should be able to: create a account, create characters to that account to a maximum of 20
  characters per account, mark a character for deletion (that will be deleted after 30 days of being marked)
  and edit a character details. The only detail that can be edited from the character will be a comment, which
   will be a player input field. Name, level, vocation and class cannot be edited. The db of choice for now
  can be H2. Also generate a README.md at the project root that explains all the endpoints created, what they
  do and how to properly run the application.

✦ Okay, I will create a Spring Boot application with Maven that provides REST endpoints for character creation
   in an MMORPG. The application will use an in-memory H2 database and include a README.md file with
  instructions.


  First, I'll generate the project structure using the Spring Initializr.

   a MMORPG. You should be able to: create a account, create characters to that account to a maximum of 20
  characters per account, mark a character for deletion (that will be deleted after 30 days of being marked)

   will be a player input field. Name, level, vocation and class cannot be edited. The db of choice for now
  can be H2. Also generate a README.md at the project root that explains all the endpoints created, what they
  do and how to properly run the application.

> I would like a Spring application, using maven, that had the endpoints responsible for character creation in a
  MMORPG. You should be able to: create a account, create characters to that account to a maximum of 20
  characters per account, mark a character for deletion (that will be deleted after 30 days of being marked) and
  edit a character details. The only detail that can be edited from the character will be a comment, which will
  be a player input field. Name, level, vocation and class cannot be edited. The db of choice for now can be H2.
  Also generate a README.md at the project root that explains all the endpoints created, what they do and how to
  properly run the application.

✦ Okay, I will create a Spring Boot application with Maven that provides REST endpoints for character creation
  in an MMORPG. The application will use an in-memory H2 database and include a README.md file with
  instructions.


  First, I'll generate the project structure using the Spring Initializr.
 ╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  Shell curl "https://start.spring.io/starter.zip?type=maven-project&language=java&platformVersion=3.3.1&p… │

                         │ed: Port number was not a decimal number between 0 and 65535
 │                                                                                                              │

   I'll create the main project directory.

 │ ✔  Shell mkdir character-creation  │

   the directories.

 │    59                         </exclude>                                                          │
 │    60                     </excludes>                                                             │
 │    61                 </configuration>                                                            │
 │    62             </plugin>                                                                       │
 │    63         </plugins>                                                                          │
 │    64     </build>                                                                                │
 │    65                                                                                             │
 │    66 </project>                                                                                  │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ I'll create the main application class now.
 ╭───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  WriteFile Writing to ...ion\\CharacterCreationApplication.java                                 │

 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation;                                                      │

 │     9     public static void main(String[] args) {                                                │
 │    10         SpringApplication.run(CharacterCreationApplication.class, args);                    │
 │    11     }                                                                                       │
 │    12                                                                                             │
 │    13 }                                                                                           │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ Now I will create the model classes for Account and Character. First, the Account entity.
 ╭───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  WriteFile Writing to ...character-creation\model\Account.java                                  │
 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.model;                                                │
 │     2                                                                                             │
 │     3 import jakarta.persistence.*;                                                               │
 │     4 import lombok.Data;                                                                         │
 │     5                                                                                             │
 │     6 import java.util.List;                                                                      │
 │     7                                                                                             │
 │     8 @Entity                                                                                     │
 │     9 @Data                                                                                       │
 │    10 public class Account {                                                                      │
 │    11                                                                                             │
 │    12     @Id                                                                                     │
 │    13     @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)                                     │
 │    14     private Long id;                                                                        │
 │    15                                                                                             │
 │    16     @Column(unique = true, nullable = false)                                                │
 │    17     private String username;                                                                │
 │    18                                                                                             │
 │    19     @OneToMany(mappedBy = "account", cascade = CascadeType.ALL)                             │
 │    20     private List<Character> characters;                                                     │
 │    21 }                                                                                           │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ Now, the Character entity.
 ╭───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  WriteFile Writing to ...haracter-creation\model\Character.java                                 │
 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.model;                                                │
 │     2                                                                                             │
 │     3 import jakarta.persistence.*;                                                               │
 │     4 import lombok.Data;                                                                         │
 │     5                                                                                             │
 │     6 import java.time.LocalDate;                                                                 │
 │     7                                                                                             │
 │     8 @Entity                                                                                     │
 │     9 @Data                                                                                       │
 │    10 public class Character {                                                                    │
 │    11                                                                                             │
 │    12     @Id                                                                                     │
 │    13     @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)                                     │
 │    14     private Long id;                                                                        │
 │    15                                                                                             │
 │    16     @Column(nullable = false)                                                               │
 │    17     private String name;                                                                    │
 │    18                                                                                             │
 │    19     private int level;                                                                      │
 │    20                                                                                             │
 │    21     private String vocation;                                                                │
 │    22                                                                                             │
 │    23     private String characterClass;                                                          │
 │    24                                                                                             │
 │    25     @Column(length = 1024)                                                                  │
 │    26     private String comment;                                                                 │
 │    27                                                                                             │
 │    28     private LocalDate deletionDate;                                                         │
 │    29                                                                                             │
 │    30     @ManyToOne                                                                              │
 │    31     @JoinColumn(name = "account_id")                                                        │
 │    32     private Account account;                                                                │
 │    33 }                                                                                           │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.repository;                                           │
 │     2                                                                                             │
 │     3 import com.example.charactercreation.model.Account;                                         │
 │     4 import org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository;                               │
 │     5                                                                                             │
 │     6 import java.util.Optional;                                                                  │
 │     7                                                                                             │
 │     8 public interface AccountRepository extends JpaRepository<Account, Long> {                   │

 │    10 }                                                                                           │

 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.repository;                                           │
 │     2                                                                                             │

 │     4 import org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository;                               │

 │     7 import java.util.List;                                                                      │
 │     8                                                                                             │

 │    10     List<Character> findByDeletionDateBefore(LocalDate date);                               │
 │    11 }                                                                                           │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ Now I'll create the service layer. First, the AccountService.
 ╭───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  WriteFile Writing to ...r-creation\service\AccountService.java                                 │
 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.service;                                              │
 │     2                                                                                             │
 │     3 import com.example.charactercreation.model.Account;                                         │
 │     4 import com.example.charactercreation.repository.AccountRepository;                          │
 │     5 import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;                              │
 │     6 import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;                                              │
 │     7                                                                                             │
 │     8 @Service                                                                                    │
 │     9 public class AccountService {                                                               │
 │    10                                                                                             │
 │    11     @Autowired                                                                              │
 │    12     private AccountRepository accountRepository;                                            │
 │    13                                                                                             │
 │    14     public Account createAccount(String username) {                                         │
 │    15         if (accountRepository.findByUsername(username).isPresent()) {                       │
 │    16             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Username already exists");                  │
 │    17         }                                                                                   │
 │    18         Account account = new Account();                                                    │
 │    19         account.setUsername(username);                                                      │
 │    20         return accountRepository.save(account);                                             │
 │    21     }                                                                                       │
 │    22 }                                                                                           │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ Now, the CharacterService. This will contain the core logic for character management.
 ╭───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  WriteFile Writing to ...creation\service\CharacterService.java                                 │
 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.service;                                              │
 │     2                                                                                             │
 │     3 import com.example.charactercreation.model.Account;                                         │
 │     4 import com.example.charactercreation.model.Character;                                       │
 │     5 import com.example.charactercreation.repository.AccountRepository;                          │
 │     6 import com.example.charactercreation.repository.CharacterRepository;                        │
 │     7 import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;                              │
 │     8 import org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.Scheduled;                                 │
 │     9 import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;                                              │
 │    10                                                                                             │
 │    11 import java.time.LocalDate;                                                                 │
 │    12 import java.util.List;                                                                      │
 │    13                                                                                             │
 │    14 @Service                                                                                    │
 │    15 public class CharacterService {                                                             │
 │    16                                                                                             │
 │    17     @Autowired                                                                              │
 │    18     private CharacterRepository characterRepository;                                        │
 │    19                                                                                             │
 │    20     @Autowired                                                                              │
 │    21     private AccountRepository accountRepository;                                            │
 │    22                                                                                             │
 │    23     public Character createCharacter(Long accountId, Character character) {                 │
 │    24         Account account = accountRepository.findById(accountId).orElseThrow(() -> new       │
 │       IllegalArgumentException("Account not found"));                                             │
 │    25         if (account.getCharacters().size() >= 20) {                                         │
 │    26             throw new IllegalStateException("Maximum number of characters reached for this  │
 │       account.");                                                                                 │
 │    27         }                                                                                   │
 │    28         character.setAccount(account);                                                      │
 │    29         return characterRepository.save(character);                                         │
 │    30     }                                                                                       │
 │    31                                                                                             │
 │    32     public Character editCharacterComment(Long characterId, String comment) {               │
 │    33         Character character = characterRepository.findById(characterId).orElseThrow(() ->   │
 │       new IllegalArgumentException("Character not found"));                                       │
 │    34         character.setComment(comment);                                                      │
 │    35         return characterRepository.save(character);                                         │
 │    36     }                                                                                       │
 │    37                                                                                             │
 │    38     public void markCharacterForDeletion(Long characterId) {                                │
 │    39         Character character = characterRepository.findById(characterId).orElseThrow(() ->   │
 │       new IllegalArgumentException("Character not found"));                                       │
 │    40         character.setDeletionDate(LocalDate.now().plusDays(30));                            │
 │    41         characterRepository.save(character);                                                │
 │    42     }                                                                                       │
 │    43                                                                                             │
 │    44     @Scheduled(cron = "0 0 0 * * ?") // Run every day at midnight                           │
 │    45     public void deleteMarkedCharacters() {                                                  │
 │    46         List<Character> charactersToDelete =                                                │
 │       characterRepository.findByDeletionDateBefore(LocalDate.now());                              │
 │    47         characterRepository.deleteAll(charactersToDelete);                                  │
 │    48     }                                                                                       │
 │    49 }                                                                                           │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ Now I'll create the controllers. First, the AccountController.
 ╭───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮

 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.controller;                                           │
 │     2                                                                                             │
 │     3 import com.example.charactercreation.model.Account;                                         │
 │     4 import com.example.charactercreation.service.AccountService;                                │
 │     5 import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;                              │
 │     6 import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;                                           │
 │     7                                                                                             │

 │    13     private AccountService accountService;                                                  │
 │    14                                                                                             │

 │    18     }                                                                                       │

 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 package com.example.charactercreation.controller;                                           │

 │     4 import com.example.charactercreation.service.CharacterService;                              │

 │    21     public Character editCharacterComment(@PathVariable Long characterId, @RequestBody      │

 │    23     }                                                                                       │
 │    24                                                                                             │
 │    25     @DeleteMapping("/{characterId}")                                                        │
 │    26     public void markCharacterForDeletion(@PathVariable Long characterId) {                  │

 │    28     }                                                                                       │
 │    29 }                                                                                           │

 ╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ Now I will create the README.md file.
 ╭───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  WriteFile Writing to character-creation\README.md                                              │
 │                                                                                                   │
 │     1 # Character Creation API                                                                    │
 │     2                                                                                             │
 │     3 This is a Spring Boot application that provides a RESTful API for character creation in an  │
 │       MMORPG.                                                                                     │
 │     4                                                                                             │
 │     5 ## Endpoints                                                                                │
 │     6                                                                                             │
 │     7 The following endpoints are available:                                                      │
 │     8                                                                                             │
 │     9 ### Accounts                                                                                │
 │    10                                                                                             │
 │    11 *   `POST /accounts`: Creates a new account.                                                │
 │    12                                                                                             │
 │    13     **Request Body:**                                                                       │
 │    14                                                                                             │
 │    15     ```json                                                                                 │
 │    16     {                                                                                       │
 │    17         "username": "your_username"                                                         │
 │    18     }                                                                                       │
 │    19     ```                                                                                     │
 │    20                                                                                             │
 │    21 ### Characters                                                                              │
 │    22                                                                                             │
 │    23 *   `POST /characters/{accountId}`: Creates a new character for the specified account.      │
 │    24                                                                                             │
 │    25     **Request Body:**                                                                       │
 │    26                                                                                             │
 │    27     ```json                                                                                 │
 │    28     {                                                                                       │
 │    29         "name": "character_name",                                                           │
 │    30         "vocation": "character_vocation",                                                   │
 │    31         "characterClass": "character_class"                                                 │
 │    32     }                                                                                       │
 │    33     ```                                                                                     │
 │    34                                                                                             │
 │    35 *   `PUT /characters/{characterId}`: Edits the comment of a character.                      │
 │    36                                                                                             │
 │    37     **Request Body:**                                                                       │
 │    38                                                                                             │
 │    39     ```json                                                                                 │
 │    40     {                                                                                       │
 │    41         "comment": "new_comment"                                                            │
 │    42     }                                                                                       │
 │    43     ```                                                                                     │
 │    44                                                                                             │
 │    45 *   `DELETE /characters/{characterId}`: Marks a character for deletion. The character will  │
 │       be deleted after 30 days.                                                                   │
 │    46                                                                                             │
 │    47 ## How to Run                                                                               │
 │    48                                                                                             │
 │    49 1.  Clone the repository.                                                                   │
 │    50 2.  Make sure you have Java 17 and Maven installed.                                         │
 │    51 3.  Navigate to the project root directory.                                                 │
 │    52 4.  Run the application using the following command:                                        │
 │    53                                                                                             │
 │    54     ```bash                                                                                 │
 │    55     mvn spring-boot:run                                                                     │
 │    56     ```                                                                                     │
 │    57                                                                                             │
 │    58 The application will be available at `http://localhost:8080`.                               │
 ╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
✦ I have created the Spring Boot application with the requested features. The application is located in the
  character-creation directory. You can run it using mvn spring-boot:run. The README.md file in the root of
  the character-creation directory explains how to use the API.
  I will now enable the scheduled tasks. To do so I will add the @EnableScheduling annotation to the main
  class.
 ╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
 │ ✔  Edit ...ion\\CharacterCreationApplication.java: package com.example.characterc... => package com.example… │
 │                                                                                                              │
 │    2                                                                                                         │
 │    3      import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;                                                 │
 │    4      import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;                               │
 │    5    + import org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.EnableScheduling;                                 │
 │    6                                                                                                         │
 │    7      @SpringBootApplication                                                                             │
 │    8    + @EnableScheduling                                                                                  │
 │    9      public class CharacterCreationApplication {                                                        │
 │    10                                                                                                        │
 │    11         public static void main(String[] args) {                                                       │
 ╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

╰─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯


> I would like a Spring application, using maven, that had the endpoints responsible for character creation in a MMORPG. You should be able to: create a account, create characters to that account to a maximum of 20 characters per account, mark a
  character for deletion (that will be deleted after 30 days of being marked) and edit a character details. The only detail that can be edited from the character will be a comment, which will be a player input field. Name, level, vocation and
  class cannot be edited. The db of choice for now can be H2. Also generate a README.md at the project root that explains all the endpoints created, what they do and how to properly run the application.

✦ Okay, I will create a Spring Boot application with Maven that provides REST endpoints for character creation in an MMORPG. The application will use an in-memory H2 database and include a README.md file with instructions.
